On IBM Z and LinuxONE systems, different networking methods are available, which are provided by the I/O subsystem that controls the LPARs, such as IBM PR/SM, or by the z/VM hypervisor. 11.3.1 z/VM virtual switch (VSWITCH) No special action is necessary to use the VSWITCH interfaces that are at the address triplet 0AD0, 0AD1, and 0AD2. The groundwork for the use of the VSWITCH interfaces was set up and configured as part of the shared user profiles. 11.3.2 Direct-attached Open Systems Adapter Linux uses the identical drivers to run a direct-attached Open Systems Adapter (OSA) that it uses to run VSWITCH interfaces.
